question: A 55-year-old female presents with profuse aching pain in both knees and limitation of movements. Her joint examination reveals Heberden nodes in distal interphalangeal joints of both hands. Which of the following conditions is associated with Heberden nodes?
A 60-year-old female with severe pain in the lumbar region has been diagnosed with osteoarthritis by her rheumatologist. What is the main pathophysiology of osteoarthritis?

answers.option: Degeneration of articular cartilage and its disordered repair
Non suppurative proliferative and inflammatory synovitis
Autoimmune inflammatory disorder of the joints

question: A 30-years-old male presented with a history of sudden onset acute pain in his big toe. He woke up in the morning with fever and malaise but was perfectly alright the day before. He denies any comorbid state nor is using any medication currently. On examination, his foot reveals an inflamed big toe with marked tenderness. What is the most likely diagnosis on clinical grounds?

A 55-year-old male presented to the clinic with the complaint of fever, weight loss, and back pain. On physical examination, extreme tenderness was noticed at the lumbar vertebrae. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the lumbar spine showed evidence of Pott’s disease. Which of the following organisms is most commonly involved in this disease process?

A 58-year-old woman discussed osteoporosis with her physician. She was worried that for a couple of years, after menopause, she was at an increased risk for osteoporosis. Which of the following is prescribed initially to prevent the risk of future problems?

answers.option: Infusion of potent bisphosphonates at large intervals
Maintaining adequate calcium and vitamin D through diet modification and/or supplementation

question: A 45-year-old lady presented with sudden-onset of difficulty in micturition, and significant bilateral lower limb weakness. Examination reveals the power of 1/5 in both lower limbs, with saddle anesthesia. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the best imaging modality for assessment of bone mineral density?
Cupping, splaying, and fraying of the lower end of the radius are seen in which of the following conditions?
Which of the following cells are responsible to regulate bone matrix formation and bone mineralization?
What is the phenomenon of friction with opposing degenerated articular surfaces producing smooth bone and burnishing the exposed bones called?
Individuals with sickle cell disease are predisposed to infection with which of the following organism, that could lead to pyogenic osteomyelitis?
Which of the following diseases is caused by ionizing radiation, X-rays, and radioactive isotopes?
A young male presents with migratory joint pain for the last 1 week. In addition, he has had diarrhea for a week. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the most common hand deformity in rheumatoid arthritis (RA)?
An 8-year-old boy with limbs relatively short when compared with his head is brought into the clinic by his parents. Which of the following cells is defective in this child's condition?
Which of the following immunosuppressants acts on dihydroorotate dehydrogenase (DHODH)?
Osteopetrosis is a disorder in which there is failure of normal bone resorption. A defect in which enzyme is responsible for causing this disease?
In which of the following diseases is a mosaic pattern of lamellar and woven bone seen?
Which of the following is not true regarding ankle-brachial pressure index (ABPI)?

answers.option: ABPI value below 0.3 is a sign of imminent necrosis
It is the ratio of blood pressure at the ankle to blood pressure in the upper arm
Blood pressure in ipsilateral limbs is measured to calculate the ABPI
The normal resting ABPI is between 0.9 and 1.3
It is the ratio of blood pressure in the upper arm to blood pressure at the ankle

question: A 35-year-old female with a known history of inflammatory bowel disease comes to the clinic with the complaint of joint pain in her hands. On examination, the abdomen is tender and oral ulcers are observed. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following antibodies are specific for CREST syndrome?
Which of the following is the most common cutaneous manifestation of systemic lupus erythematosus?
Which of the following antibodies is specific for polymyositis and dermatomyositis?
Which deformity of the knee is most commonly seen in osteoarthritis?
Which of the following is NOT a predisposing factor for the development of osteoarthritis in the knee?

A 38-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of lower back pain, undocumented weight loss, and mild fever on and off for the last 5 months. Family history is significant for a younger sister diagnosed with tuberculosis (TB), who has not started her prescribed anti-tuberculous therapy yet. On examination, lumbar spine is tender and sensations are reduced in the lower limbs. Which disease is the patient most likely to have?
Sabre shin is a feature of congenital syphilis. Which part of the tibia is typically affected?
Patients with osteoarthritis may develop bony swellings at the distal interphalangeal (DIP) and proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joints. What are the swellings at DIP joints called?
In patients with osteoarthritis of the knee, the pain usually worsens during which of the following actions?

A 6-year-old girl is brought to the clinic with symmetrical swelling of hand and knee joints for the past 6 days. On examination, the girl has a temperature of 99.8°F with a faint pink rash on the chest, abdomen, and back. The joints are warm and mildly swollen with pain on movement. Which investigation is most appropriate to diagnose the disorder in this girl?

answers.option: No test - clinical diagnosis of exclusion

question: Which investigation is most specific for a diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis?

answers.option: Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) and C-reactive protein (CRP)

question: A 64-year-old woman is brought into the emergency department with the complaint of severe lower back pain after she suffered a fall while walking outside her house. Physical examination reveals kyphosis and height loss. Which of the following radiological investigations is the most appropriate first choice to establish a diagnosis of the underlying disorder?
Which disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) can be safely given to pregnant patients?
Which beta-lactam penicillin drug can not be given orally?

A 27-year-old man presents to the outpatient clinic with complaint of chronic lower back pain and is diagnosed with ankylosing spondylitis after appropriate workup. Which of the following is the best initial treatment?

A 28-year-old patient previously diagnosed with ankylosing spondylitis comes to the outpatient clinic with complaints of no improvement in symptoms with the prescribed NSAIDs and recommended exercise regimen. Which of the following is the best 2nd line treatment for his condition?
Which of the following autoimmune diseases is associated with the highest rate of malignancy?
Which of the following is the best first step of management for osteoarthritis?
Which of the following is the best investigation to determine the causative organism in a patient with osteomyelitis?

answers.option: Bone biopsy or aspiration with culture

question: A 69-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic for follow-up of a vertebral fracture suffered recently after a fall. Her dual X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA) scan reveals a T-score of -2.8. She complains about insignificant pain relief with the medications she was previously prescribed. The doctor prescribes her a drug that is known to decrease the pain associated with vertebral fractures. Which of the following is this drug most likely to be?
Which of the following drugs causes systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)?

A 30-year-old female is brought to the emergency room following a generalized seizure. She is on medications for systemic lupus erythematosus for the past year since her diagnosis. This is the fourth episode of fits she has had in the past 2 weeks. What medication should the patient be given?

A 25-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with pain in the small joints of her hand associated with a peculiar butterfly-shaped rash over her cheeks and nose. She was diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus 6 months back. On examination, the interphalangeal joints are swollen and painful. Urine detailed report is negative for proteins. What treatment should be given to this patient?

answers.option: Avoid sun exposure + anti malarials + celecoxib

question: Which of the following drugs is used for the treatment of acute gout?

A 30-year-old boxer presents with progressively increasing back pain, faecal and urinary incontinence. On examination, perineal sensations are also decreased. The patient is fully conscious and oriented to the surroundings. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 55-year-old female, para 11+2, presents to the outpatient clinic with bilateral knee and back pain for the past 6 months. The doctor recommends an investigation for determining the bone mineral density. What is the investigation of choice?
A female has developed paresthesia and tetany after undergoing thyroid surgery. What is the cause of these symptoms?

A 36-year-old female presents to her physician with difficulty combing her hair and muscle weakness for the past year. Chest examination reveals bilateral coarse crackles. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following features differentiates dermatomyositis from polymyositis?

A 30-year-old female presents to the physician with chronic progressive difficulty in getting up from the floor during her daily prayers. Her complaint is associated with peculiar rashes on the face and eyelids for 4-months. Examination reveals bilateral proximal muscle weakness. Muscle biopsy taken from the biceps femoris muscle will most likely show what histopathological finding?
Which of the following inhibits purine synthesis?
What is the principal indication for the measurement of serum anti-CCP antibodies in rheumatoid arthritis?
Which of the following features differentiates polymyositis from dermatomyositis?

answers.option: Muscle weakness is seen only in polymyositis
Cutaneous features are only seen in dermatomyositis
One of them is an immunological disease
Myalgia is seen in only one of them

question: A 69-year-old female has presented with a wrist fracture. She had menopause at the age of 52. She also had a wrist fracture 2 years back. What treatment will you give her along with fracture treatment?
A 60-year-old woman with fractures presents to the office, she had been taking long-term steroids, how do we treat her?

A 20-year-old female presents with pain in the wrist and hand joints and a typical malar rash for the past 2 weeks. On investigation, urine is negative for proteins. Her past medical records show that she is a diagnosed patient with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). What treatment should be given to this patient?
An osteoarthritis patient was given non-pharmacological treatment which did not improve their condition. What is the next step in management?
What is the most common cause of osteomyelitis in neonates?
What is the most common cause of osteomyelitis in intravenous drug abusers?
What is the key clinical feature to differentiate degenerative joint changes from inflammatory joint changes?
During a 1000m race, a kid collapses during the final part of the race and is rushed to the hospital for treatment. What is the most probable cause of this kid's collapse?
An 8-year-old child presents to the outpatient clinic with a history of joint pain, swelling, rashes on the buttocks, and occasional abdominal pain. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What are the stages of osteoarthritis?
Which of the below enlisted is a characteristic finding on plain radiograph of a patient with osteoarthritis?

A 40-year-old man presents to the emergency department with a swollen, exquisitely painful big toe. The attending physician started intravenous fluids and indomethacin, making a provisional diagnosis of gout. However, he fails to improve. The patient is afebrile, and no other joint is involved. His mother arrives and gave a detailed history, that he had few episodes of bloody diarrhea a few weeks back for which they took treatment from a local doctor. Hearing this, the doctor immediately changed his differential. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old female presents to the physician with complaints of abdominal discomfort and weakness. She has a history of rheumatoid arthritis, for which she takes methotrexate. Examination shows splenomegaly, conjunctival pallor, and skin hyperpigmentation. Laboratory tests show 700 neutrophils per microliter of blood. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following are components of Reiter's syndrome?

A 28-year-old male presents to the clinic because of swollen, painful small joints in his right hand. On examination, there is a scaly rash on the extensor surfaces of the skin and scalp. Which of the following diagnosis is most consistent with this case?
Osteomyelitis is most commonly a bacterial infection that arises via hematogenous spread. Which of the following organisms is the most common cause of this disease?
Pannus formation is a feature of which of the below-enlisted hematological conditions?
Which of the following drugs is least likely to cause an attack of acute gout?
A child presents to the clinic with joint pain, abdominal pain, and a rash on the buttocks. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 55-year-old female has been brought to the emergency room following severe lower back pain following a fall from standing height in the bathroom. A radiograph reveals fracture of the neck of femur. General examination reveals kyphosis and height loss. Which of the following investigations is the best choice for confirmation of the underlying disorder?

answers.option: DEXA scan of lumber spine and hip

question: A patient recently diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis is prescribed methotrexate 10mg weekly and corticosteroid 10 mg daily. He is followed up monthly, and the dose of methotrexate increased to 25mg but improvement fails to occur. After 6 months, the doctor concludes the medication regime to be ineffective. What is the next step in the management of this patient?

answers.option: Give high dose steroids and decrease gradually

question: What is the most suitable drug for the treatment of chronic gout?
Which of the following antibodies are present in CREST syndrome?
Which of the following statements is true regarding dermatomyositis?

answers.option: It has a characteristic perioral rash
Tissue biopsy reveals typical inclusion bodies
Cytotoxic T cells play a major role in pathogenesis

question: Which of the following is the most common cause of pyogenic osteomyelitis?
Which of the following is true regarding rheumatoid factor?
70-80% of the patients with rheumatoid arthritis are seropositive for which of the following?
Which one of the following is the most common extra-articular feature in ankylosing spondylitis?
What joint is most commonly involved in pseudogout?
What type of facial rash is commonly seen with SLE?
A 7-year-old boy presents with back pain and red-eye for the past 10 days. Past history includes a diarrheal illness preceding the current symptoms of the patient. What is the most likely diagnosis?
In contrast to gout, which of the folowing is the most commonly involved joint in pseudogout?

A 40-year-old female patient presents with back pain and extreme weight loss. She was diagnosed with breast cancer 5 years ago but she denied chemotherapy or any other form of treatment. What will be the next best investigation?
Which of the following gene mutations is associated with seronegative arthropathies?
Which of the following structures is the sphenoid bone embryological derived from?
Which of the following is a classic clinical feature of axial spondyloarthritis?

answers.option: Upper back pain radiating to the shoulder
Lower back pain radiating to the buttocks

question: Which of the following is not a cause of osteoporosis?
A 40-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with bone pain that worsens at night and is relieved by taking NSAIDs. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following is a benign, painful tumor of the bone that presents as a bony mass greater than 2 cm with radiolucent osteoid core and is unresponsive to NSAIDs?
Which of the following mutations is commonly seen in Paget disease of bone?
A 50-year-old postmenopausal woman comes into the clinic with a leg fracture. She has had an inactive lifestyle her whole life. What is the ideal drug to be prescribed to treat her fracture?
An 8-year-old male child presents with unilateral thigh swelling and a restricted range of motion. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 69-year-old presents to the orthopedic department complaining of severe knee pain. Pain is localized to the anterior region and gets worse when climbing the stairs. On examination, he has tenderness in the joint line, anterior patello-femoral joint crepitus, and varus deformity at the knee joint. There is also a mild to moderate effusion. The doctor suspects osteoarthritis. What should be the next step in his management?

A 30-year-old male comes to the emergency room with a history of polytrauma after a road traffic accident. He has a mid-shaft right humeral fracture, ipsilateral ulnar, radius, and femoral fractures as well. What is the best treatment option for this patient?

answers.option: Open reduction and internal fixation with broad deep compression plate (DCP)

question: A 57-year-old mechanic presents with increasing left-sided groin pain over the past 4 months. He has no systemic illnesses apart from diabetes mellitus that is well controlled. On examination, he has a Body Mass Index (BMI) of 30 kg/m2. There is reduced passive internal rotation of the hip to about 10 degrees and reduced flexion of up to 50 degrees with pain. X-ray of the pelvis shows left femoral head collapse, reduced joint space, and osteophytes at the superolateral aspect of the acetabulum. What is the most appropriate treatment?

A 60-year-old female with left glenohumeral joint osteoarthritis for 3 years presents with joint pain that is not relieved by medication. Examination reveals restricted abduction, internal, and external rotation with mild swelling around the shoulder joint. X-ray reveals reduced joint space in the glenohumeral joint, osteophytes in the acromioclavicular joint. What will be the most appropriate treatment option?

A 20-year-old male presents to the clinic with complaints of localized, dull, aching pain of the right tibia, particularly at night, and is relieved with aspirin. He has no history of trauma. X-ray shows a radiolucent nidus with a rim of reactive bone around the diaphysis of the proximal tibia. What is the most likely benign tumor that causes nocturnal pain in this patient?

A 3.5-year-old boy has a fragile skeleton with a history of repeated fractures. He has short stature, clinical evaluation reveals growth retardation, blue sclera, teeth abnormalities, and impaired hearing. His older sister also has similar complaints. His parents had consanguineous marriage. Which of the following is the best diagnosis?

A 70-year-old lady presents to the outpatient department with complaints of pain in the lower limbs. X-rays showed anterior bowing of both femurs. Histopathological evaluation reveals increased but disordered and structurally unsound bone mass and characteristic mosaic pattern of the lamellar bone. Her mother also had a similar bone pathology what is the most likely disease?

A middle-aged male presents with complaints of bone pain. He has compromised renal function. Laboratory tests show deranged renal function tests along with abnormal mineral metabolism. Histopathological examination shows features of osteoporosis, brown tumors, and osteitis fibrosa cystica. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnosis in this case?
Which one of the following is not a cutaneous manifestation of systemic lupus erythematosus?
What is the most common route for the spread of infection in children's cases of osteomyelitis?
What is true about patellofemoral osteoarthritis?

answers.option: It is usually unilateral in nature
Usually the pain is posteriorly in the knee
It presents with pain while climbing up the stairs
Its also another name for hip osteoarthritis

question: A patient presented in the emergency after a road traffic accident. On examination, the neck veins are distended and the trachea is in the midline. On auscultation, the heart sounds are muffled. What is the most probable diagnosis?
What is true about associations with Lambert-Eaton syndrome?

answers.option: Resting of the eyelids (looking downwards) may be followed by increased reflex elevation with up-gaze (so-called Cogan’s lid twitch sign)
It is associated with small cell lung carcinoma
Worsening of symptoms towards the end of the day or following exercise is characteristic
Antibodies to acetylcholine receptors in the post-junctional membrane of the neuromuscular junction

question: A patient presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of bone pain and deafness for the past few days. He also complains about increasing hat size. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following is false about the treatment of acute osteomyelitis?

answers.option: Take blood sample before starting antibiotics
High dose antibiotics against Staph aureus, Streptococci and gram-negative Bacteria
Prognosis is good in 90% cases with appropriate treatment
Surgery is needed in non-responsive cases

question: A middle-aged woman presents to the clinic with a complaint of swelling on the left side of the neck. Investigation reveals an increase in serum calcium levels. What is the most common cause of primary hyperparathyroidism?
What is the purpose of an MRI in a patient with Ewing's sarcoma?

answers.option: To assess the zone of transition
To guide a biopsy of the lesion

question: A young male patient presents to the clinic with complaints of pain in the knee and ankle joints, redness of the eyes, and pain on micturition. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presents to the outpatient department with complaints of difficulty in swallowing, red eyes, and parotid gland swelling. Anti-ro antibodies and anti-la antibodies are positive. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient presents with complaints of alopecia, malar rash, and photosensitivity. Her urinalysis shows proteins+ and red blood cells+. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following best describes the findings in osteoarthritis?

answers.option: Asymmetric narrowing of joint spaces and osteophyte formation
Pain in the metacarpophalangeal and proximal interphalangeal joints
Reduced surface area of the affected joints
Symmetrical narrowing of joint spaces and radiolucent periarticular region.

question: A patient was prescribed hydralazine in order to control her hypertension. She later developed a malar rash, photosensitivity, and arthritis. What is the most likely diagnosis in this case?

A 33-year-old female, who is a known case of depression and is being treated with sertraline, presents to the clinic with the complaint of generalized body aches. Her laboratory results show serum calcium 2.18 mmol/l, serum phosphate 0.79 mg/dl, alkaline phosphatase 178 IU/l, and parathyroid hormone 15 pg/ml. What is the most likely diagnosis in this case?
Which of the following is the most consistent feature of hip osteoarthritis?

A child presents to the clinic with the complaint of pain and swelling in the right knee, left ankle, and small joints of hands and feet. He had a history of fever one month back. He has increased platelets but a normal total leucocyte count. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old female patient who has six children and has been lactating her last child for 3 months presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of overall body aches, and difficulty in getting up from a sitting position. On investigation, she has hemoglobin of 11.2 g/dl, mean corpuscular volume: of 64 fL, and serum calcium level: of 8.1 mg/dl. What is the probable diagnosis of the patient?
What type of electrolyte imbalance is seen after exercise?
What will be the probable diagnosis for a young male having joint pain for one week with a history of infection?
Rheumatoid factor is produced against which type of antibody?
Which of the following diseases is associated with Gottron's papules and heliotrope rash?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding osteoarthritis?

answers.option: The onset is palindromic, with relapsing and remitting episodes of pain, stiffness and swelling that last for only a few hours or days
It causes degeneration of articular cartilage
It causes ulnar deviation of the fingers, ‘swan neck’ deformity, the boutonnière or ‘button hole’ deformity, and a Z deformity of the thumb
Limitation of lumbar spine movement in sagittal and frontal planes
Low back pain > 3 months improved by exercise and not relieved by rest

question: A 35-year-old man presents to the outpatient department with complaints of lower back pain and morning stiffness lasting for over six months. He describes his pain improves with exercise but worsens with rest. The patient also mentions experiencing pain and swelling in his left knee joint. On examination, there is limited lumbar spine flexibility and tenderness over the sacroiliac joints. X-rays reveal sacroiliitis and syndesmophytes in the spine. Laboratory tests show positive HLA-B27 antigen. what is the most likely diagnosis of his condition?

A 12-year-old girl presents with severe pain in both knees, ankles, and wrists. Her heart rate, temperature, and respiratory rate are all raised. She also has a recent history of a throat infection. Clinical examination of which system will aid in diagnosis?

An intravenous drug user presents with the complaint of burning micturition and fever for 3 days. He also has gritty eyes and lower back pain for the past 3 months. He also has an ulcer on the glans of the penis. What is the most likely cause of these symptoms?
Which of the following is considered the diagnostic test for osteoporosis?

A 30-year-old man presented to his family physician with complaints of joint pain. He reported that the pain was moderate to severe and that he found relief by taking NSAIDs. Which of the following clinical features would suggest that the patient has seronegative spondyloarthropathies?

answers.option: Pain and stiffness improves with rest
Inflammatory bowel symptoms precede the joint pain
Small joint involved in majority of cases
Low back pain and early morning stiffness with radiation to the buttocks or posterior thighs

question: Which of the following is the primary role of the parathyroid gland?

answers.option: To send hormonal signals to other endocrine organs
To receive hormonal signals from the hypothalamus

question: A 50-year-old woman has had no major medical problems but has not been physically active for most of her life. One day after falling out of bed, she immediately noticed a sharp pain in her right hip. She is subsequently unable to ambulate without severe pain. Radiographs show a fracture of the left femoral head and a compressed fracture of T10. Which of the following conditions is she most likely to have?

A 57-year-old male, a known case of diabetes and hypertension, presents with a history of severe pain in his right big toe. On examination, his first metatarsophalangeal joint is markedly tender and shows signs of inflammation. What could be the most likely cause of his condition?

A 65-year-old male presents with a history of severe knee joint pain bilaterally. He describes that he has had this pain intermittently for the last 4 years. He has gotten multiple medical treatments, but the pain has been refractory to all of them. An x-ray of the knee joint shows signs of advanced osteoarthritis. What is the best treatment opinion for him?
A force within normal limits is exerted repeatedly leading to a fracture. What is this type of fracture called?

A young female presents to the clinic with a history of pain in the small joints of her hands and tightening of her skin for 3 months. She is also having difficulty swallowing and has oral ulcers. On examination, her blood pressure is 140/90 mmHg and she is noted to have a small mouth and epicanthal folds. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A young female presents to the clinic with acute lupus nephritis. Which of the following is the best treatment option for her?
Which condition presents with the classic rash that takes the form of a heliotrope discoloration of the upper eyelids?
Which of the following is true regarding osteoarthritis?

answers.option: Pain increases with activity and is relieved by rest
Osteopenia and looser zones are characteristic radiological findings
Symmetric involvement of only the small joints is seen
Caused by increased levels of parathyroid hormones

question: A 42-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with complaints of progressive pain in different joints of the body, including small joints of the hands and knee joint for 2 months. She also has morning stiffness for about one hour every day. On examination, she has swelling of small joints of the hands and mild anemia. Which of the following investigations is most helpful in establishing a diagnosis?

A 17-year-old girl presents to the outpatient department with complaints of low-grade fever, oral ulcers, and pain in small joints of her hands for 6 months. She is also having decreased urination with frothy urine. On examination, she has patchy hair loss, bilateral pedal edema, and swollen joints. Which of the following investigations has the highest prognostic value?

A 42-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of low back pain for the past few years. He also has morning stiffness and pain which mostly stays for 2-3 hours. Currently, he has been experiencing pain in the back of his right ankle, however, there is no history of trauma. Which of the following is the most appropriate investigation to establish the diagnosis?

A 67-year-old male, retired from his occupation, presents to the clinic with a complaint of non-radiating backache. He has lost 3 kg weight and his height is reduced by 3.5 cm. There is no comorbid, history of smoking or alcohol. DEXA scan shows a T score of -2.3 at the femoral neck. What is the best treatment plan for this patient?

answers.option: NSAID group of drugs, calcium and vitamin D supplement
Bisphosphonate, lifestyle modification, calcium and vitamin D supplements
Bisphosphonate, lifestyle modification and calcium supplement
Lifestyle modification, calcium and vitamin D supplements

question: The criteria for classification of systemic lupus erythematosus does not contain which of the following?

A 5-year-old boy comes with complaints of muscle weakness. He is not able to stand up from a sitting/cross-legged position. His brother has a similar condition. Which single investigation will lead you to the final diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most common cause of hypoparathyroidism?
Which of the following refers to the lateral deviation of the big toe of the right foot?

An 11-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with complaints of fever, pain, and swelling in joints. The symptoms have been present for 10 days. Four days ago, his right knee was painful and swollen but it was resolved, and later, his right ankle and left knee joint were also involved. Previous history is positive for sore throat 4 weeks back which responded to symptomatic treatment. On examination, he is febrile, respiratory rate is 32/min and heart rate is 160/min. His left knee and right ankle joint are swollen and extremely tender and warm. There is a restricted range of motion. The routine investigation is as follows: CBC normal, ESR 110, and antistreptolysin O titer (ASOT) are 1:800. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 38-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of back pain for 3 years. There is no history of skin lesions or inflammatory bowel disease. On X-ray, there is involvement of the sacroiliac joint. What is the probable diagnosis?
A 40-year-old male is diagnosed with gout based on the synovial fluid analysis of his knee joint. Which of the following is an indication to start urate-lowering therapy?

answers.option: Evidence of bone or joint damage

question: A 50-year-old obese male presents to the clinic with complaints of pain and swelling in the first metatarsophalangeal joint of the left big toe for 2 days. He has a history of alcohol intake for 10 years. The given explanation best corresponds to which of the following?

answers.option: Presence of monosodium urate crystals in synovial fluid

question: A 28-year-old female is found to have deep vein thrombosis. She also has a history of two miscarriages. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a radiological feature of vitamin D deficiency?

A female patient presents to the outpatient department with complaints of dysphagia and muscle weakness most severe in the quadriceps and distal upper extremity muscles. Laboratory studies show elevated creatine kinase and the presence of antibodies to cN1A. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient presents to the clinic with swelling of the 1st metatarsophalangeal joint. Which lab investigation will confirm the diagnosis?

answers.option: Urate crystals in aspirated joint fluid

question: A woman presented to the clinic with complaints of anorexia, constipation, increased thirst, and urinary frequency. Her serum calcium level was 12 mg/dl and her serum parathyroid hormone level was 135 pg/ml. What condition was she suffering from?

A 15-year-old girl from a low socioeconomic background presents to a primary healthcare facility with complaints of low-grade fever, back pain, and significant weight loss. Her sister had tuberculosis some time back. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 20-year-old boy presents to the orthopedic clinic with back pain. On examination, he has fixed deformity of the cervical, dorsal, and lumbar spine. X-ray shows sclerosis of the iliosacral joint. His ESR and CRP are normal. Rheumatoid factor is found to be negative while HLA-B27 is positive. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the drug of choice in acute gout?

A 23-year-old boy has increasing eye pain and decreased vision, which worsens upon sunlight exposure. History reveals the presence of low back pain for the past 3 years. Which of the following systemic diseases must be looked for in this patient?

A 25-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of arthritis and morning stiffness of multiple small joints of the hands. He also reports a history of intermittent attacks of diarrhea for 6 months. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A middle-aged man presents to the clinic with joint pain, urethritis, and conjunctivitis. He has also developed a calcaneal spur. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 71-year-old man has experienced aching pain in the right knee, lower back, right distal fifth finger, and neck over the past 10 years. He notices that the joints feel slightly stiff in the morning, but this passes quickly. The pain is worse toward the end of the day. On physical examination, there is no joint swelling, warmth, or deformity. Some joint crepitus is audible on moving the knee. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A lady presents to the outpatient department with pain in multiple joints and a rash over her eyelids and periorbital area. Anti-Mi2 antibody is found to be positive. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A woman presents to the clinic with pain and tenderness in the lower back and a rash over the extensor surfaces of the body. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 58-year-old postmenopausal woman is worried about osteoporosis. What is the initial recommendation?

answers.option: Maintaining adequate calcium and vitamin D intake through diet modification and/or supplementation

question: What is the most appropriate pharmacological action of acetaminophen?
